ParentCompanyName: QEP Field Services, LLC dba Tesoro Logistics-Rocki

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements: Risk Management Programs under section 112 (r) of the Clean Air Act Amendments, 40 CFR 68.79, for Tesoro Logisitics Belfield Gas Plant.

Location: The Belfield Gas Plant is located in Stark County, North Dakota approximately two (2) miles south of Belfield, North Dakota and about .5 miles west of Highway 85.  The facility operates at the intersection of 131st Ave. SW and 38th St. SW and has a legal location indicated as the NW1/4 NW1/4 Section 17, Township 139N, Range 99W.

Process Description:
Tesoro Logistics operates the Belfield Gas Plant located in Stark County, North Dakota (ND). The gas plant is located 2 miles south of Belfield, ND on US Hwy 85 and ½ mile west on 38 Street SW. The facility runs 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. The site is manned 24 hours a day by operators located at the plant site. 
The plant processes natural gas delivered from production wells. The natural gas enters the plant via gathering pipelines. The gas then flows through the inlet receiver process to remove all free liquids.  The inlet compressors gather the inlet field gas coming into the plant at between 10-50 psig and compress it to the H2S removal process before going to the NGL plant of approximately 450 psig.  The compressed gas is then routed through a Refrigeration Plant with ethylene glycol injection which seperates water and NGL friom the stream.  The rich EG is routed to the dehydration still column, which is heated from the facility hot oil heaters, to assist in driving off the water and regenerating the lean EG.  The gas stream from the still column consists primarily of water vapor, which is condensed and sent to storage tanks and vapors can be burned at a Steffes Flare.  All flash vapors off of the EG flash tank are captured by process and routed back to the facility inlet slug catcher.  At the NGL plant outlet, the gas

is compressed to approximately 1200 psig and sold to WBI Pipeline Company.  Extensive natural gas liquids (NGL) are produced from the NGL plant and are routed to two (2) pressurized NGL storage tanks.  

The extracted NGLs (Y-Grade, Propane, Butane and Natural Gasoline) are collected in tanks then transported, via tanker trucks/pipeline, for additional processing and/or marketing. 

Program Level:
It has been determined that this is a Program 1 facility.  There are no public or environmental receptors within the range of the worst case release scenario.  This facility is subject to OSHA's Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals regulation, 29 CFR 1910.119.  

Prevention and Response Policies:
The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are provided in the facility's Process Safety Management Guidelines manual.  The plant's emergency response plan has been coordinated with the Stark County Local Emergency Planning Committee (LEPC) and agency personnel will have a chance to tour the facility.  Tesoro Logisitcs takes an active role in preventing accidental releases at its facility by ensuring that employees are trained in the safe operation of the plant and evacuation procedures.  

Stationary Source and Regulated Substances: 
The facility contains a fractionated NGL product storage and shipping process.  Ethane, propane, butane, and pentane are the primary components of the NGL inventory listed in the RMP rule.  Propane is used as refrigerant in the refrigeration process.
 All of the chemicals above the RMP threshold are classified as flammable and not toxic. As such, only a flammable release scenario has been analyzed for the Belfield Gas Plant.

Accident History:
This is a relatively new facility and, therefore, has not experienced an incident that resulted in injuries or environmental damage as defined in the RMP rule in the past five years.

Emergency Response Program:
The facility has established and mainta

ins an emergency action plan that is coordinated with local response agencies.   The plan is designed to protect personnel on the site, to ensure their safe and orderly evacuation in event of an emergency, and to provide notification, appropriate information and protection for emergency response personnel.
